texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: In the event that your system is running out of file descriptors, or you simply want to know what your users are doing, you can review their count of open files by running this command:
texts.text: In the event that your system is running out of file descriptors, or you simply want to know what your users are doing, you can review their count of open files by running this command:

texts.label: code
texts.orig: lsof | grep ' root ' | awk '{print $NF}' | sort | wc -l
texts.text: lsof | grep ' root ' | awk '{print $NF}' | sort | wc -l

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Of course, if you want to drop the count and show the actual processes, you can run:
texts.text: Of course, if you want to drop the count and show the actual processes, you can run:
